verses.kjv: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,
verses.ct: Then Job continued his discourse and said,

verses.kjv: As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul;
verses.ct: "As surely as God lives — the one who has denied me justice, the Almighty who has made my soul bitter —

verses.kjv: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;
verses.ct: as long as I still have breath in me and the spirit of God remains in my lungs,

verses.kjv: My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.
verses.ct: my lips will never speak anything evil, and my tongue will never utter a lie.

verses.kjv: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.
verses.ct: I will never agree that you are right! Until my dying day, I will not abandon my integrity.

verses.kjv: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.
verses.ct: I cling to my righteousness and will not release it. My conscience will not condemn me for as long as I live.

verses.kjv: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
verses.ct: May my enemies be treated like the wicked, and those who oppose me like the unrighteous.

verses.kjv: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?
verses.ct: What hope does a godless person have when they've gained everything, if God takes away their soul?

verses.kjv: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?
verses.ct: Will God listen to their cries when disaster strikes them?

verses.kjv: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?
verses.ct: Will they find joy in the Almighty? Will they call on God at all times?

verses.kjv: I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
verses.ct: I will teach you about the power of God. I won't hide what the Almighty has in store.

verses.kjv: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?
verses.ct: Look, all of you have seen these things for yourselves — so why are you talking such nonsense?

verses.kjv: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.
verses.ct: This is what God assigns to the wicked, the inheritance that oppressors receive from the Almighty:

verses.kjv: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
verses.ct: If their children are many, they are destined for the sword, and their descendants will never have enough food.

verses.kjv: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.
verses.ct: Those who survive them will be buried by plague, and their widows will not mourn for them.

verses.kjv: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;
verses.ct: Even if they pile up silver like dust and stockpile clothing like heaps of clay,

verses.kjv: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.
verses.ct: they may accumulate it, but the righteous will wear it, and the innocent will divide up the silver.

verses.kjv: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.
verses.ct: The house they build is as fragile as a moth's cocoon, like a temporary shelter a watchman puts up.

verses.kjv: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.
verses.ct: The wealthy person lies down rich but will not remain so; they open their eyes, and everything is gone.

verses.kjv: Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.
verses.ct: Terrors overwhelm them like a flood, and a storm sweeps them away during the night.

verses.kjv: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.
verses.ct: The east wind carries them off, and they are gone — it rips them violently from where they lived.

verses.kjv: For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.
verses.ct: God hurls judgment at them without mercy; they desperately try to escape his power.

verses.kjv: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
verses.ct: People will clap their hands in scorn and drive them from their place with hissing."
